body.p: Resiliency is achieved through setting up a network of MiVoice Business systems in a resilient cluster that can direct IP phones, routes and maintain calls.
body.note: While setting up the resiliency, ensure that the resiliency parameter values such System Name, PBX Number, Zone, CEID Digits, Feature DN values are different for the primary and secondary MiVB application.

row.entry: Enter a unique name of up to nine characters for the network element.
Defines the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) or IP Address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the network element specified during deployment. This value is pre-filled.
The unique identifier assigned to the element. The PBX Number range is 1-999.
The zone specified for the IP voice media stream originating or terminating at the selected 3300 ICP/MiVoice Business system. The zone range is 1-999.

Enter a CEID (Cluster Element Identifier) digit string. Assign unique CEID digit strings to each cluster element. In a network that is configured for the Voice Clustering (Portable Directory Number) feature, the CEID digit string allows calls to be routed between elements in the network. The CEID digit strings for remote elements must translate to a programmed ARS route, list, or plan for correct call routing. Choose a value of up to 7 digits.

For the local element enter a feature directory number. For a remote element, enter the feature directory number that corresponds to the local feature directory number of the remote element within the cluster. Choose a value of up to 7 digits.
Enter a unique name of up to 128 characters for the cluster.

Specify the master MiVB address of the existing cluster.
This field is visible only if you deploy the uccs-ext bundle.

Enter the master MiVB password
This field is visible only if you deploy the uccs-ext bundle.
